thread.title: Mali among the UN's deadliest missions
thread.title_full: Mali among the UN's deadliest missions | News24

author: news24.com
title: Mali among the UN's deadliest missions
text:
Stockholm - The UN peacekeeping mission in Mali is one of the deadliest missions in the history of the UN blue helmets, with 60 deaths, Stockholm research institute Sipri said on Monday.
In its report " Fatality Trends in UN Peace Operations ", the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (Sipri) said a total of 1 938 UN soldiers had been killed since the first UN peacekeeping mission in the Middle East in 1948, but almost three-quarters of those were due to accidents or were natural deaths.
The highest mortality rates took place in the 1990s with two very small missions in Tajikistan and Georgia, which had three and eight deaths respectively.
The Unosom II mission in Somalia, from 1993-1995, came in third place with 148 deaths, including 109 violent ones, out of 19 000 peacekeepers.
